Det övergripande syftet med projektet är att ge ett fullt fungerande system för maktfördelning och ändra tankesätt om demokrati genom reform av en demokratisk konstitution, institutioner, demokratisk kultur, ansvarsfulla politiska ledare och aktiva och engagerade medborgare i Turkiet.
CBN kommer att genomföra ett antal aktiviteter genom följande CBN-program; Empowerment, informationsdelning;
Resultat 1: Medborgare och gräsrotsorganisationer är informerade och kunniga om reformagendan, lagstiftning och parlament och blir mer nyfikna och styrkta inom ämnet och lagstiftningsförfaranden
Resultat 2: Demokratiska principer och system för maktfördelning integreras genom nya koncept, innovativa mekanismer och verktyg. med stöd av pro-demokratiska medborgare för att främja hållbar och rättvis utveckling.
Medborgarutbildning
Resultat 3: Medborgare som inkluderar ungdoms- och kvinnogrupper, organisationer i det civila samhället förbättrar sina förmågor, kunskaper och färdigheter när det gäller att övervaka lagstiftningssystem och demokrati för att delta effektivt i beslutsprocesserna.
Medborgerligt engagemang och deltagande
Resultat 4: Medborgare och särskilt gräsrotsorganisationer blir mer inflytelserika förespråkare för inkluderande, deltagande reformer samt politik och arbetar tillsammans för att delta i beslutsfattande både på nationell nivå och lokal nivå.
Styrning
Resultat 5: CBN: s övergripande styrningskapacitet, effektivitet inom hubbar och kompetens utvecklas och medlemmarnas ägande av CBN uppnås.
Räckvidd och kommunikation: kommer att följas upp inom alla resultatområden

The overall aim of the project is to empower a fully working system of checks and balances and change mindset towards democracy through reform of democratic constitution, institutions, interiorized democratic culture, responsible political leaders and active and engaged citizens in Turkey. CBN will conduct a number of activities through the following CBN programs: Empowerment; information sharing; Outcome 1: Citizens and grassroots organisations are informed and knowledgeable on reform agenda, legislations and parliament and become more inquisitive and empowered on the subject matter and legislative procedures Outcome 2: Democratic principles and checks and balances notions are mainstreamed through new concepts, innovative mechanisms and tools; with the support of pro democratic citizens to promote sustainable and fair development. Civic Education Outcome 3: Citizens including the youth and women groups, civil society organizations improve their abilities, knowledge and skills on monitoring legislative systems and democracy to participate in the decision-making processes effectively. Advocacy; civic engagement and participation Outcome 4: Citizens and especially grassroots become more influential advocates for inclusive, participatory reforms and policies and work together to engage in decision making both at national level and local level. Governance Outcome 5: CBN’s overall governance capacity, effectiveness in hubs and competencies are developed and members ownership of CBN is achieved. Outreach and Communications: Will be followed up for all result areas The contribution will be implemented by Checks and Balances Network (CBN, Network): an independent network that consists of 300 CSOs working on different areas and representing different segments of the society encompassing all of the country. The Network consists of Reform Groups and local groups (formed in 8 cities) formed by the members. Currently there are 7 reform groups that work on different subjects which are: the constitution, government, parliament/policitical parties, judiciary, local government, media, civil society. These reform groups monitor the developments on the issues on their working subject, initiate campaigns, publish policy reports or media declarations. The Network acts as a consensus medium where CSOs from different segments of society agree to secure checks and balances in each policy area. CBN is a network of CSOs that work together on freedom, equality, stability, justice, prosperity and peace, in order to strengthen pluralistic democracy.

description.narrative:
Outcome 1: Citizens and grassroots organisations are informed and knowledgeable on reform agenda, legislations and parliament and become more inquisitive and empowered on the subject matter and legislative procedures
1 call paper, 2 policy documents and 4 analysis reports were published on issues falling within the scope of checks and balances. 4 Checks and Balances Bulletins were published, in which the political developments in the field of the checks and balances were evaluated. Within the scope of our Mecliste.org work, 2 Analysis Reports, 6 Evaluation Notes, 4 Brief Notes, and 2 "Through the lens of Mecliste.org" Expert Opinions were produced. 4 political parties were visited and 14 MPs were contacted. Notable report include Regulatory and Supervisory Institutions and Balance Supervision Report, Strengthened Parliamentary Balance and Recommendations for Transition to the System Audit Evaluation Report, Central Budget Law and 2022 Central Government Budget Evaluation report and Empowered in Parliament Parliamentary System Discussions Report.
Latest work of CBN was Key Benchmarks for a Parliamentary System with Checks and Balances Workshop Final Report.
Outcome 2: Democratic principles and checks and balances notions are mainstreamed through new concepts, innovative mechanisms and tools; with the support of pro democratic citizens to promote sustainable and fair development.
Within the scope of the Enhancing Democratic and Active Citizen Participation Project, a total of 1553 people participated in the training, meetings, workshops, expert meetings and reform group activities organized by the Checks and Balances Network in 2021.
1059 people participated in the checks and balances game, which was designed as the best way to reflect the pluralistic and innovative nature of the network.
The Democracy Roundtable Workshop was held with the participation of 61 people, where the Checks and Balances Mechanisms in the Strengthened Parliamentary System were discussed. 4 expert focus group meetings were held and 35 people attended.
Outcome 3: Citizens including the youth and women groups, civil society organizations improve their abilities, knowledge and skills on monitoring legislative systems and democracy to participate in the decision-making processes effectively.
Legislative monitoring, participation and evaluation trainings were organized for a civil society that participates in the legislative processes more effectively. 45 participants from 18 different provinces of Turkey and 12 different fields of work attended the trainings held on 25-26-27 October and 22-23-24 November. So that citizens and civil society organizations monitor the legislative systems and participate in the decision-making processes effectively.
Outcome 4: Citizens and especially grassroots become more influential advocates for inclusive, participatory reforms and policies and work together to engage in decision making both at national level and local level.
As part of Imagine Cities, 22 online workshops and 4 regional panels were held. 244 people from 38 different cities attended the imagination workshops. 24 people received trainer training. These activities have attracted interest and is expected to continue.
Outcome 5: CBNs overall governance capacity, effectiveness in hubs and competencies are developed and members ownership of CBN is achieved.
Participatory and inclusive cities were opened for discussion in the provinces of stanbul, Ankara, zmir, Adana, Mersin, Tarsus, Kahramanmara, Gaziantep, Hatay, Van, Kars, Diyarbakr, Ordu, Samsun and Trabzon. 11 experts and 147 participants attended the regional webinars.
19 online live broadcasts and 12 podcast broadcasts were made. The total number of views reached 4,646 in live broadcasts and 487 in podcasts. The number of followers in social media accounts reached 7,015 on Twitter, 9,074 on Facebook, 483 on YouTube, and 1,233 on Instagram. The network appeared 35 times in the national press and 5 in the local press. Participated in 2 live broadcast programs as a guest.
CBN also acts as a facilitator to meet and engage with local CSOs as they have a vast reach of CSOs with their current members or through their members.
